An implementation of the Turing Machine.

Author:
Donal Cahill

Constructor Detail

TuringMachine

public TuringMachine(java.lang.String blank,
                     java.lang.String[] dictionary,
                     Tape tape,
                     State initialState,
                     java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,State> stateList)
Class constructor.

Parameters:
dictionary - an array of Strings, one of which can be written to any cell
tape - the Tape with which this TuringMachine is initially loaded. If tape points to null, a blank tape is used
initialState - the initial State of this TuringMachine
stateList - the HashMap linking String names of States and their variable names
Method Detail

execute

public void execute()
The main loop of this TuringMachine. Keeps executing operations until the State called "HALT", upon which this TuringMachine exits the and prints some final information.

getTapeString

public java.lang.String getTapeString()
Returns:
a String of symbols from the portion of this TuringMachine's Tape which has been accessed
